reviews.review:
Needs controller support. Made do with a 3rd party remapping program.
Control in the air is a bit weird, as though the character has more inertia than expected, and I found myself drifting into hazards easily.

But awkward controls with tight jumps and positioning would be fine were it not for the life system. You get [b]three lives plus one life per checkpoint. Use them[/b] all up (which you will) [b]and it's game over.[/b]

Continues cost special gems that you only get at special checkpoints, and bring you to the very start of the entire level. So, good luck with that.

[b]It's an awkward-to-control precision platformer that you will have to grind and grind and grind the same areas over and over and over until you've memorized every last inch.[/b]
